holidays.name: Fruitcake Toss Day
holidays.description: A day devoted to the humorous tradition of tossing or regifting those infamous dense, nut-and-candied-fruit-packed cakes that seem to multiply each holiday season.
holidays.origin: Rooted in the widespread love-hate relationship with fruitcake, this unofficial day celebrates the fruitcake's resilience and the sometimes comical way people dispose of or re-gift them.
holidays.funFact: The world's largest fruitcake weighed over 1.7 tons and was made in the USA in 2011!

holidays.name: Make Cut-Out Snowflakes Day
holidays.description: Time to bust out the scissors and paper for an artsy winter craft‚Äîcreating delicate, intricate paper snowflakes to brighten up any space.
holidays.origin: Paper snowflakes have been a winter-time craft tradition for centuries, and this day encourages creativity and childlike joy during the cold season.
holidays.funFact: No two paper snowflakes are alike, just like the real ones found in nature!

holidays.name: National Fruitcake Day
holidays.description: An official day to honor the infamous holiday fruitcake, celebrating this dense dessert filled with nuts, dried fruits, and plenty of history.
holidays.origin: Observed in the United States, this day recognizes the fruitcake as a classic holiday treat with roots tracing back to Roman times.
holidays.funFact: Fruitcakes are known for their remarkable shelf life; some fruitcakes have been found still edible after decades.

holidays.name: No Interruptions Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to get some peace and quiet by minimizing interruptions, perfect for catching up on work, reading, or just relaxing without distractions.
holidays.origin: Created to boost productivity and mental well-being by allowing focused and uninterrupted time.
holidays.funFact: This day is especially beloved by introverts and office workers looking for a rare moment of silence.
